frame.name: People_by_vocation
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their vocation.
The <fen>Person</fen> is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have a <fen>Descriptor</fen>, <fen>Origin</fen>, <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen>, or <fen>Ethnicity</fen>. A specific <fen>Age</fen> may sometimes be specified as well.</def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Origin</fen> is the place where the <fen>Person</fen> was born or lived a salient part of her or his life.</def-root>

FE.name: Persistent_characteristic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen> is a physiological characteristic or personality trait of the <fen>Person</fen> which is concieved of as persisting over time.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> is a temporary condition of the <fen>Person</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Age
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Age</fen> is the length of time the <fen>Person</fen> has been alive.</def-root>

FE.name: Ethnicity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Ethnicity</fen> is the religious, racial, national, socio-economic or cultural group to which the <fen>Person</fen> belongs.</def-root>

FE.name: Context_of_acquaintance
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression indicating the context with which the <fen>Person</fen> is associated.
<ex>Is she the <t>actress</t> <fex name="coa">from the movie we saw last night</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Rank</fen> is the position in a hierarchy that a <fen>Person</fen> occupies within an organization.
<ex>Robin is the <fex name="rnk">head</fex> <t>waitress</t> at La Notte.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place_of_employment
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Place where the <fen>Person</fen> works.</def-root>

FE.name: Employer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Employer</fen> gives compensation to an <fen>Person</fen> for their work.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Type</fen> of the vocation that the <fen>Person</fen> practices.</def-root>

FE.name: Compensation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Compensation</fen> is the payment that the <fen>Person</fen> receives for performing a task.</def-root>

FE.name: Contract_basis
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Contract_basis</fen> describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.
<ex>Smithers is a <fex name="cb">half-time</fex> <t>clerk</t> for Procteur et Gamble </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: politician.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who is professionally involved in politics, especially as a holder of an elected office

lexUnit.name: farmer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who owns or manages a farm.

lexUnit.name: attendant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: person employed to provide a service to the public.

lexUnit.name: clerk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person employed in an office or bank to keep records or accounts and to undertake other routine administrative duties.

lexUnit.name: consultant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who provides expert advice professionally.

lexUnit.name: gardener.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody who works on the planting and upkeep of gardens, parks, etc.

lexUnit.name: lawyer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who practises or studies law, especially (in the UK) a solicitor or a barrister or (in the US) an attorney.

lexUnit.name: maid.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a female domestic servant.

lexUnit.name: manager.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who manages an organization or group of staff.

lexUnit.name: professor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a university teacher.

lexUnit.name: receptionist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who greets and deals with clients and visitors to a surgery, office, hotel, etc

lexUnit.name: salesman.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person whose job involves selling or promoting commercial products

lexUnit.name: servant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person employed to perform duties for others, especially in a house on domestic duties or as a personal attendant.

lexUnit.name: waiter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man whose job is to serve customers at their tables in a restaurant

lexUnit.name: carpenter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who makes wooden objects and structures

lexUnit.name: scientist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences.

lexUnit.name: private eye.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a private detective

lexUnit.name: actress.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a woman employed performing fictional roles in play, film, television, etc.

lexUnit.name: waitress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman whose job is to serve customers at their tables in a restaurant.

lexUnit.name: technician.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person employed to look after technical equipment or do practical work in a laboratory.

lexUnit.name: toxicologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person employed in the field of the study of poisons.

lexUnit.name: engineer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person qualified in engineering.

lexUnit.name: double agent.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an agent who pretends to act as a spy for one country while in fact acting for its enemy.

lexUnit.name: soldier.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who serves in an army.

lexUnit.name: guerrilla.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a member of a small independent group taking part in irregular warfare, typically against larger regular forces.

lexUnit.name: researcher.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: someone whose job is to conduct research.

lexUnit.name: archaeologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who professionally studies human history and history by examining physical artifacts.

lexUnit.name: professional.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, relating to, or belonging to a profession.

lexUnit.name: agent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who represents another person or organization

lexUnit.name: journalist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who works in the field of journalism - news, some forms of photography, etc.

lexUnit.name: judge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who presides over a courtroom and makes decisions brought to the court of law

lexUnit.name: mechanic.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a repairman that works on various kinds of machinery

lexUnit.name: oilman.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who works in the oil-extraction industry

lexUnit.name: reporter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who reports news, as in journalism

lexUnit.name: scholar.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who studies professionally within a certain field

lexUnit.name: veterinarian.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who specializes in animal medicine

lexUnit.name: trader.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who professionally trades a commodity

lexUnit.name: mole.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who works as a spy, often with a complex fake identity behind enemy lines

lexUnit.name: spy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who works as a secret agent in order to obtain information, sabotage infrastructure, etc.

lexUnit.name: businessperson.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who works in some form of business

lexUnit.name: speculator.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who invests money into something (e.g. land, commodities, stocks) and profits from the fluctuation of prices

lexUnit.name: architect.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who designs and builds buildings

lexUnit.name: plain-clothes man.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a law enforcement officer wearing plain (not police uniform) clothing.

lexUnit.name: magistrate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an official who presides of court proceedings and, in many cases, decides them.

lexUnit.name: officer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a member of a governmental institution tasked with collecting information and protecting public safety

lexUnit.name: police_officer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an employee of a law enforcement institution
